sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Stability Chamber for long-term and accelerated stability studies.
sections.scope: Applicable to stability testing activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the chamber is connected to a stable power and water supply.
Set the required temperature and humidity (e.g., 40Â°C/75% RH).
Allow the chamber to reach and stabilize at set conditions.
Load samples in specified containers and arrange for air circulation.
Record temperature and humidity daily from the display or data logger.
Conduct periodic inspections for water levels and sensor functionality.
Retrieve samples at scheduled intervals for analysis.
Document any deviations from set storage conditions.
Perform regular calibration of sensors and maintenance of the humidifier.
Maintain a detailed log of sample entry and retrieval.
precautions: Do not overload the chamber to ensure uniform condition distribution.
Keep door openings to a minimum duration.
Use only distilled or deionized water for humidity generation.
Report alarm conditions immediately to the department head.
Ensure backup monitoring systems are functional.
